title: Can psychological drama be literary? - Quora

response.answer_text: (Almost) any text can theoretically be/come literary. The Russian Formalists were energetic in trying to establish “literariness” (literaturnost) so that we can tell “formally” when some prose is a report, article, school essay or literary short story. When verse, metrical or not, with or without rhyme, is poetry or greeting card sentiment. A TV advert could be great (brief) drama. Ezra Pound said that when he wrote a short lyrical poem, it was the intense core of a much longer (unwritten) drama.
All depends on execution, but I certainly can see that happening. All quiet on the Western Front deals with psychological trauma, and it’s regarded as modern literature so… yea
